measurement.buffer: 100 mM NaCl, 0.1% (w/v) PEG 8000, HEPES, Tricine, or Tris (thrombin); 80 mM NaCl, 10 mM CaCl2, 0.1% (w/v) PEG 8000, and 100 mM HEPES, Tricine, or Tris (trypsin)
measurement.protein_concentration: 50 uM (2L to thrombin); 60 uM (3L to thrombin)
measurement.ligand_concentration: 0.5 mM (2L to thrombin); 0.6 mM (3L to thrombin)
measurement.injection_volume: 1.4 uL (2L to thrombin); 1.9 uL (3L to thrombin); 1.5-1.8 uL (3L to trypsin)
measurement.time_between_injections: 180 s (2L and 3L to thrombin); 220 s (3L to trypsin)
measurement.total_injections: 15 (2L to thrombin); 12 (3L to thrombin); 20-25 (3L to trypsin)

control: Titrations performed in three different buffer systems (HEPES, Tricine, and Tris) enabled correction for any proton transfer occurring between the buffer and protein upon complex formation.
